snippet.textDisplay:
When the creators came out and said they were going to redesign Sonic, considering a large portion of the 3d animation had already been done, I was saddened because I at this point, knew what it would mean, a bunch of the corporate team saying "uh yeah fix it" and to the animators it would mean living at their desks working until they physically can't. I was wondering whether they'd even get paid, and doubting it, low and behold the branch closed down and people lost their jobs.
From what I gather most people were praising them for doing the redesign endlessly, except anyone who's versed or has animated, because they knew the workload and what that would mean.
snippet.textOriginal:
When the creators came out and said they were going to redesign Sonic,  considering a large portion of the 3d animation had already been done, I was saddened because I at this point, knew what it would mean, a bunch of the corporate team saying "uh yeah fix it" and to the animators it would mean living at their desks working until they physically can't. I was wondering whether they'd even get paid, and doubting it, low and behold the branch closed down and people lost their jobs. 
From what I gather most people were praising them for doing the redesign endlessly, except anyone who's versed or has animated, because they knew the workload and what that would mean.

snippet.textDisplay:
I laughed pretty hard at the "Sanic" picture tbh. I understood not flashing his badge during the bar fight.. I figure it was b/c he didn't wanna call attention to himself + in the middle of a bar brawl... would flash your badge really do anything in a large crowd of drunk brawlers? plus i doubt anyone would've heard him haha


As for flashing it to the lady at the building..... that was dumb b/c yeah.. also how come no cops were at the Sister's place? I mean, wouldn't that be 1 of the 1st places they would've looked?
The reloading also.. I THOUGHT THE SAME THING!?! Why would a super genius build his machines to reload?


Also why did he need to go to the top of the building thru the building? He's Sonic, he was literally stopping time, couldn't he just run fast enough to fight gravity and scale the building?
snippet.textOriginal:
I laughed pretty hard at the "Sanic" picture tbh. I understood not flashing his badge during the bar fight.. I figure it was b/c he didn't wanna call attention to himself + in the middle of a bar brawl... would flash your badge really do anything in a large crowd of drunk brawlers? plus i doubt anyone would've heard him haha


As for flashing it to the lady at the building..... that was dumb b/c yeah.. also how come no cops were at the Sister's place? I mean, wouldn't that be 1 of the 1st places they would've looked? 
The reloading also.. I THOUGHT THE SAME THING!?! Why would a super genius build his machines to reload? 


Also why did he need to go to the top of the building thru the building? He's Sonic, he was literally stopping time, couldn't he just run fast enough to fight gravity and scale the building?

snippet.textDisplay: His brain not being able to keep up with Sonic is actually part of why he loses in the end, being attacked by so many directions so fast that he doesn't know how to defend. His ship also has a degree of auto pilot and was probably calibrated to handle the quill so that meant he could give chase without any foolish crashing mistakes.
snippet.textOriginal: His brain not being able to keep up with Sonic is actually part of why he loses in the end, being attacked by so many directions so fast that he doesn't know how to defend. His ship also has a degree of auto pilot and was probably calibrated to handle the quill so that meant he could give chase without any foolish crashing mistakes.

snippet.textDisplay:
I honestly think the only reason this movie didn't totally suck ass was because (at least I think) the actual people making the film probably put love into this film. Like, every person who had hands on involvement probably wanted to make this cash grab good, and it was pretty decent for what it was. It was a simple, cheesy kids movie, but I found myself feeling emotions that the movie wanted me to feel. Sonic felt sad that he was a loner outcast, and I felt bad for him.
This movie doesn't win any awards to me, and if you ask me Detective Pikachu did this but better, but I still found myself enjoying the film.
Also I loved Jim Carrey in this movie idk what you're talking about. I loved his energy and his egotism. I've played a bunch of Sonic games, and I think he freaking NAILED Eggman as a character.
snippet.textOriginal:
I honestly think the only reason this movie didn't totally suck ass was because (at least I think) the actual people making the film probably put love into this film.  Like, every person who had hands on involvement probably wanted to make this cash grab good, and it was pretty decent for what it was.  It was a simple, cheesy kids movie, but I found myself feeling emotions that the movie wanted me to feel.  Sonic felt sad that he was a loner outcast, and I felt bad for him.
This movie doesn't win any awards to me, and if you ask me Detective Pikachu did this but better, but I still found myself enjoying the film.
Also I loved Jim Carrey in this movie idk what you're talking about.  I loved his energy and his egotism.  I've played a bunch of Sonic games, and I think he freaking NAILED Eggman as a character.

snippet.textDisplay: As a Sonic fan, I appreciated Green Hill zone, a few spoilers I can't talk about, and the depth Sonic had (considering he's usually trying to get away from his friends, to the point where "long time no see" is their fucking greeting to each other). I even found myself treating the whole thing like a 90s movie with all the product placement. As a Sonic fan, this was a pretty decently put together film, but I do find it lacking since there isn't a whole bunch of Sonic vs Robotnik in it. I get they probably had to cut down a fuck ton just to make the new design work, though I was kind of hoping for more than one big battle against the two. Maybe the sequel will be better. Kinda seems like a certain someone needs him back home, so maybe the next movie will take place in Sonic's world. I realized that you'd need a relatively big budget for that, but considering how much this movie is making I wouldn't denounce it as a possibility. Also, is it that much to ask that the music sounds like it's from the games? The guy who scored Sonic 1 said he scored it like a movie, so why not use the game's music? Spring yard zone for example would've been perfect for the bar scene.
snippet.textOriginal: As a Sonic fan, I appreciated Green Hill zone, a few spoilers I can't talk about, and the depth Sonic had (considering he's usually trying to get away from his friends, to the point where "long time no see" is their fucking greeting to each other). I even found myself treating the whole thing like a 90s movie with all the product placement. As a Sonic fan, this was a pretty decently put together film, but I do find it lacking since there isn't a whole bunch of Sonic vs Robotnik in it. I get they probably had to cut down a fuck ton just to make the new design work, though I was kind of hoping for more than one big battle against the two. Maybe the sequel will be better. Kinda seems like a certain someone needs him back home, so maybe the next movie will take place in Sonic's world. I realized that you'd need a relatively big budget for that, but considering how much this movie is making I wouldn't denounce it as a possibility. Also, is it that much to ask that the music sounds like it's from the games? The guy who scored Sonic 1 said he scored it like a movie, so why not use the game's music? Spring yard zone for example would've been perfect for the bar scene.

snippet.textDisplay:
I reckon they screwed up the design deliberately. Anyone who knows anything about sonic would know most of the games arent very good and the shows are mediocre at best.

the only thing thats been keeping that franchise alive is his physical design. People really like the character model for some reason. So how did that dodgey one from the movie get approved?

But then again we always get these sorts of modern kids movies that are an adaption of some old title like sonic or smurfs or trolls or alvin and the chipmunks. This one would surely just blend in with the rest and not make much money or get sequels or stand out or anything. but what if they fucked up so unimaginably bad with the design, (the primary thing that makes people like him) intentionally. and then as soon as they decided to change it and release it with a new design people flock to it and give it good reviews and lots of ticket sales, id assume its mainly because they acknowledge the studio for listening to them and changing it.

but i kinda think the people that genuinly think its an 8 or 9/10 are more caught up in what it almost was compared to what they got, so theyre just really happy it at least wasnt that monster sonic from the original trailer. And fuckin sony have been pullin the strings all along... playin us like god damn fiddles.... but we see through it. Coz i myself, and i assume many others have or will slowly come to agree that at the end of the day all we want is one thing... the uncut version... with the freak sonic.

This movie is average at best, but if they left the shit design itd at least be more of a "good" bad movie, coz when you look at it objectively the "good" bad movies at least stay in your memory and you share them and talk about them and can have a good time going back to them, but sonic is probably just doomed to fade into being another average kids movie based on old property. Because like most of those movies (though not necisarally bad) they just arent memorable....

But when they release the uncut version i'll watch that shit a million times over. Just to get a look at tails' mid credits scene in freak form. There was an uncut sonic from before they redesigned it there MUST be a tails out there somewhere we havnt seen, AND I DEMAND WE GET THIS OPPORTUNITY

but i kinda think the people that genuinly think its an 8 or 9/10 are more caught up in what it almost was compared to what they got, so theyre just really happy it at least wasnt that monster sonic from the original trailer. Coz i myself, and i assume many others have or will slowly come to agree that at the end of the day all we want is one thing... the uncut version... with the freak sonic. 

This movie is average at best, but if they left the shit design itd at least be more of a "good" bad movie, coz when you look at it objectively the "good" bad movies at least stay in your memory and you share them and talk about them and can have a good time going back to them, but sonic is probably just doomed to fade into being another average kids movie based on old property. snippet.textDisplay:
Some other minor nitpicks/inconsistencies that bothered me while watching:
- Sonic destroys the energy infrastructure of the entire town but phones work. Not just cellphones (despite the effect being so large it turned off satellites) but regular phones too
- Not only does the sheriff guy gets into a commercial building after being hunted as a terrorist, they make a joke about him kidnapping a child and no one really cares
- Sonic sends the sheriff to his hometown at day and a few minutes later when Sonic arrives it's night, despite portal travel being shown as instantaneous and Sonic only racing Robotnik for a few minutes at most
snippet.textOriginal:
Some other minor nitpicks/inconsistencies that bothered me while watching:
- Sonic destroys the energy infrastructure of the entire town but phones work. Not just cellphones (despite the effect being so large it turned off satellites) but regular phones too
- Not only does the sheriff guy gets into a commercial building after being hunted as a terrorist, they make a joke about him kidnapping a child and no one really cares
- Sonic sends the sheriff to his hometown at day and a few minutes later when Sonic arrives it's night, despite portal travel being shown as instantaneous and Sonic only racing Robotnik for a few minutes at most

snippet.textDisplay:
Imo the Jim Carrey Robotnik were the only enjoyable parts of the movie at all.
That cop was so generic and brain dead I couldn't believe what I was seeing. He just had no emotional response to being reported as a terrorist in national television even though he just got his "dream job", was just like haha I punched Robotnik in the face ahah yea flossing. The actor was literally orange the entire movie, it also really bothered me.
There was no consequences for his actions, like for example: starting a bar fight.being a cop, driving right after he drank beer at the bar, *being called a terrorist in national television*, allegedly kidnapping a child (to those ppl knowledge), destroying a bunch of shit, being an enemy of the government, etc the list goes on
Nothing has any consequences and he doesn't emotionally respond to anything

My 8 year old LOVES SONIC. He plays with little sonic toys, watches Sonic Boom (a 3D animated kids show), and plays those dogshit next gen sonic games.

snippet.textDisplay:
The studio shutting down had nothing to do with the Sonic movie. It was because of market pressures in the Vancouver area and lacking tax breaks.
https://www.cinemablend.com/news/2486721/sonic-the-hedgehogs-redesign-studio-is-closing

Direct quote from the article:

A statement from parent company Technicolor cited “increasing external market pressures” in Vancouver as well as “attractive opportunities in other locations” as the reason behind the shuttering of MPC Vancouver.
snippet.textOriginal:
The studio shutting down had nothing to do with the Sonic movie. It was because of market pressures in the Vancouver area and lacking tax breaks.
https://www.cinemablend.com/news/2486721/sonic-the-hedgehogs-redesign-studio-is-closing

Direct quote from the article:

A statement from parent company Technicolor cited “increasing external market pressures” in Vancouver as well as “attractive opportunities in other locations” as the reason behind the shuttering of MPC Vancouver.

snippet.textDisplay: An explanation for Robotnik being able to chase Sonic: The idea is that he's so smart that his mind moves way faster than others. Mentally, he's as fast as Sonic, but not physically. That, OR, Sonics' hyperspeed thing where time slows down basically works like The World from Jojo in that you're not going faster, everything else is going slower.
snippet.textOriginal: An explanation for Robotnik being able to chase Sonic: The idea is that he's so smart that his mind moves way faster than others. Mentally, he's as fast as Sonic, but not physically. That, OR, Sonics' hyperspeed thing where time slows down basically works like The World from Jojo in that you're not going faster, everything else is going slower.
